4304  }
4305 
4306  return this;
4307 }
4308 
4309 int IndexExpr::EstimateCost() const {
4310  if (index == NULL || baseExpr == NULL)
4311  return 0;
4312 
4313  const Type *indexType = index->GetType();
4314  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4315 
4316  if ((indexType != NULL && indexType->IsVaryingType()) ||
4317  (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL && baseExprType->IsVaryingType()))
4318  // be pessimistic; some of these will later turn out to be vector
4319  // loads/stores, but it's too early for us to know that here.
4320  return COST_GATHER;
4321  else
4322  return COST_LOAD;
4323 }
4324 
4325 void IndexExpr::Print() const {
4326  if (!baseExpr || !index || !GetType())
4327  return;
4328 
4329  printf("[%s] index ", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
4330  baseExpr->Print();
4331  printf("[");
4332  index->Print();
4333  printf("]");
4334  pos.Print();
4335 }
4336 
4337 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4338 // MemberExpr
4339 
4340 /** Map one character ids to vector element numbers. Allow a few different
4341  conventions--xyzw, rgba, uv.
4342 */
4343 static int lIdentifierToVectorElement(char id) {
4344  switch (id) {
4345  case 'x':
4346  case 'r':
4347  case 'u':
4348  return 0;
4349  case 'y':
4350  case 'g':
4351  case 'v':
4352  return 1;
4353  case 'z':
4354  case 'b':
4355  return 2;
4356  case 'w':
4357  case 'a':
4358  return 3;
4359  default:
4360  return -1;
4361  }
4362 }
4363 
4364 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4365 // StructMemberExpr
4366 
4367 class StructMemberExpr : public MemberExpr {
4368  public:
4369  StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4370 
4371  static inline bool classof(StructMemberExpr const *) { return true; }
4372  static inline bool classof(ASTNode const *N) { return N->getValueID() == StructMemberExprID; }
4373 
4374  const Type *GetType() const;
4375  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4376  int getElementNumber() const;
4377  const Type *getElementType() const;
4378 
4379  private:
4380  const StructType *getStructType() const;
4381 };
4382 
4383 StructMemberExpr::StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4384  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue, StructMemberExprID) {}
4385 
4386 const Type *StructMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4387  if (type != NULL)
4388  return type;
4389 
4390  // It's a struct, and the result type is the element type, possibly
4391  // promoted to varying if the struct type / lvalue is varying.
4392  const Type *exprType, *lvalueType;
4393  const StructType *structType;
4394  if (expr == NULL || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) || ((structType = getStructType()) == NULL) ||
4395  ((lvalueType = GetLValueType()) == NULL)) {
4396  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4397  return NULL;
4398  }
4399 
4400  const Type *elementType = structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4401  if (elementType == NULL) {
4402  Error(identifierPos, "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s", identifier.c_str(),
4403  structType->GetString().c_str(), getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4404  return NULL;
4405  }
4406  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(lvalueType->GetBaseType(), elementType));
4407 
4408  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType) && CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType)->IsSlice());
4409  if (isSlice) {
4410  // FIXME: not true if we allow bound unif/varying for soa<>
4411  // structs?...
4412  AssertPos(pos, elementType->IsSOAType());
4413 
4414  // If we're accessing a member of an soa structure via a uniform
4415  // slice pointer, then the result type is the uniform variant of
4416  // the element type.
4417  if (lvalueType->IsUniformType())
4418  elementType = elementType->GetAsUniformType();
4419  }
4420 
4421  if (lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
4422  // If the expression we're getting the member of has an lvalue that
4423  // is a varying pointer type (be it slice or non-slice), then the
4424  // result type must be the varying version of the element type.
4425  elementType = elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
4426 
4427  type = elementType;
4428  return type;
4429 }
4430 
4431 const Type *StructMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4432  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4433  return lvalueType;
4434 
4435  if (expr == NULL) {
4436  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4437  return NULL;
4438  }
4439 
4440  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() : expr->GetLValueType();
4441  if (exprLValueType == NULL) {
4442  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4443  return NULL;
4444  }
4445 
4446  // The pointer type is varying if the lvalue type of the expression is
4447  // varying (and otherwise uniform)
4448  const PointerType *ptrType = (exprLValueType->IsUniformType() || CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4449  ? PointerType::GetUniform(getElementType())
4450  : PointerType::GetVarying(getElementType());
4451 
4452  // If struct pointer is a slice pointer, the resulting member pointer
4453  // needs to be a frozen slice pointer--i.e. any further indexing with
4454  // the result shouldn't modify the minor slice offset, but it should be
4455  // left unchanged until we get to a leaf SOA value.
4456  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) && CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
4457  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
4458 
4459  lvalueType = ptrType;
4460  return lvalueType;
4461 }
4462 
4463 int StructMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4464  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4465  if (structType == NULL)
4466  return -1;
4467 
4468  int elementNumber = structType->GetElementNumber(identifier);
4469  if (elementNumber == -1)
4470  Error(identifierPos, "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s", identifier.c_str(),
4471  structType->GetString().c_str(), getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4472 
4473  return elementNumber;
4474 }
4475 
4476 const Type *StructMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
4477  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4478  if (structType == NULL)
4479  return NULL;
4480 
4481  return structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4482 }
4483 
4484 /** Returns the type of the underlying struct that we're returning a member
4485  of. */
4486 const StructType *StructMemberExpr::getStructType() const {
4487  const Type *type = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() : expr->GetLValueType();
4488  if (type == NULL)
4489  return NULL;
4490 
4491  const Type *structType;
4492  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
4493  if (rt != NULL)
4494  structType = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
4495  else {
4496  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
4497  AssertPos(pos, pt != NULL);
4498  structType = pt->GetBaseType();
4499  }
4500 
4501  const StructType *ret = CastType<StructType>(structType);
4502  AssertPos(pos, ret != NULL);
4503  return ret;
4504 }
4505 
4506 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4507 // VectorMemberExpr
4508 
4509 class VectorMemberExpr : public MemberExpr {
4510  public:
4511  VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4512 
4513  static inline bool classof(VectorMemberExpr const *) { return true; }
4514  static inline bool classof(ASTNode const *N) { return N->getValueID() == VectorMemberExprID; }
4515 
4516  llvm::Value *GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
4517  llvm::Value *GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
4518  const Type *GetType() const;
4519  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4520 
4521  int getElementNumber() const;
4522  const Type *getElementType() const;
4523 
4524  private:
4525  const VectorType *exprVectorType;
4526  const VectorType *memberType;
4527 };
4528 
4529 VectorMemberExpr::VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4530  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue, VectorMemberExprID) {
4531  const Type *exprType = e->GetType();
4532  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(exprType);
4533  if (exprVectorType == NULL) {
4534  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
4535  if (pt != NULL)
4536  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(pt->GetBaseType());
4537  else {
4538  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL);
4539  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
4540  }
4541  AssertPos(pos, exprVectorType != NULL);
4542  }
4543  memberType = new VectorType(exprVectorType->GetElementType(), identifier.length());
4544 }
4545 
4546 const Type *VectorMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4547  if (type != NULL)
4548  return type;
4549 
4550  // For 1-element expressions, we have the base vector element
4551  // type. For n-element expressions, we have a shortvec type
4552  // with n > 1 elements. This can be changed when we get
4553  // type<1> -> type conversions.
4554  type = (identifier.length() == 1) ? (const Type *)exprVectorType->GetElementType() : (const Type *)memberType;
4555 
4556  const Type *lvType = GetLValueType();
4557  if (lvType != NULL) {
4558  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvType) && CastType<PointerType>(lvType)->IsSlice());
4559  if (isSlice) {
4560  // CO AssertPos(pos, type->IsSOAType());
4561  if (lvType->IsUniformType())
4562  type = type->GetAsUniformType();
4563  }
4564 
4565  if (lvType->IsVaryingType())
4566  type = type->GetAsVaryingType();
4567  }
4568 
4569  return type;
4570 }
4571 
4572 llvm::Value *VectorMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4573  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4574  return MemberExpr::GetLValue(ctx);
4575  } else {
4576  return NULL;
4577  }
4578 }
4579 
4580 const Type *VectorMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4581  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4582  return lvalueType;
4583 
4584  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4585  if (expr == NULL) {
4586  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4587  return NULL;
4588  }
4589 
4590  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() : expr->GetLValueType();
4591  if (exprLValueType == NULL)
4592  return NULL;
4593 
4594  const VectorType *vt = NULL;
4595  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4596  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget());
4597  else
4598  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4599  AssertPos(pos, vt != NULL);
4600 
4601  // we don't want to report that it's e.g. a pointer to a float<1>,
4602  // but a pointer to a float, etc.
4603  const Type *elementType = vt->GetElementType();
4604  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4605  lvalueType = new ReferenceType(elementType);
4606  else {
4607  const PointerType *ptrType = exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ? PointerType::GetUniform(elementType)
4608  : PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
4609  // FIXME: replicated logic with structmemberexpr....
4610  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) && CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
4611  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
4612  lvalueType = ptrType;
4613  }
4614  }
4615 
4616  return lvalueType;
4617 }
4618 
4619 llvm::Value *VectorMemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4620  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4621  return MemberExpr::GetValue(ctx);
4622  } else {
4623  std::vector<int> indices;
4624 
4625  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
4626  int idx = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[i]);
4627  if (idx == -1)
4628  Error(pos, "Invalid swizzle character '%c' in swizzle \"%s\".", identifier[i], identifier.c_str());
4629 
4630  indices.push_back(idx);
4631  }
4632 
4633  llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
4634  const Type *basePtrType = NULL;
4635  if (dereferenceExpr) {
4636  basePtr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
4637  basePtrType = expr->GetType();
4638  } else {
4639  basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
4640  basePtrType = expr->GetLValueType();
4641  }
4642 
4643  if (basePtr == NULL || basePtrType == NULL) {
4644  // Check that expression on the left side is a rvalue expression
4645  llvm::Value *exprValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
4646  basePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(expr->GetType()->LLVMType(g->ctx));
4647  basePtrType = PointerType::GetUniform(exprVectorType);
4648  if (basePtr == NULL || basePtrType == NULL) {
4649  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4650  return NULL;
4651  }
4652  ctx->StoreInst(exprValue, basePtr);
4653  }
4654 
4655  // Allocate temporary memory to store the result
4656  llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(memberType->LLVMType(g->ctx), "vector_tmp");
4657 
4658  // FIXME: we should be able to use the internal mask here according
4659  // to the same logic where it's used elsewhere
4660  llvm::Value *elementMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
4661 
4662  const Type *elementPtrType = NULL;
4663  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(basePtrType) != NULL)
4664  elementPtrType = PointerType::GetUniform(basePtrType->GetReferenceTarget());
4665  else
4666  elementPtrType = basePtrType->IsUniformType() ? PointerType::GetUniform(exprVectorType->GetElementType())
4667  : PointerType::GetVarying(exprVectorType->GetElementType());
4668 
4669  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4670  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
4671  char idStr[2] = {identifier[i], '\0'};
4672  llvm::Value *elementPtr =
4673  ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, indices[i], basePtrType, LLVMGetName(basePtr, idStr));
4674  llvm::Value *elementValue = ctx->LoadInst(elementPtr, elementMask, elementPtrType);
4675 
4676  const char *resultName = LLVMGetName(resultPtr, idStr);
4677  llvm::Value *ptmp = ctx->AddElementOffset(resultPtr, i, NULL, resultName);
4678  ctx->StoreInst(elementValue, ptmp);
4679  }
4680 
4681  return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, LLVMGetName(basePtr, "_swizzle"));
4682  }
4683 }
4684 
4685 int VectorMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4686  int elementNumber = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[0]);
4687  if (elementNumber == -1)
4688  Error(pos, "Vector element identifier \"%s\" unknown.", identifier.c_str());
4689  return elementNumber;
4690 }
4691 
4692 const Type *VectorMemberExpr::getElementType() const { return memberType; }
4693 
4694 MemberExpr *MemberExpr::create(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue) {
4695  // FIXME: we need to call TypeCheck() here so that we can call
4696  // e->GetType() in the following. But really we just shouldn't try to
4697  // resolve this now but just have a generic MemberExpr type that
4698  // handles all cases so that this is unnecessary.
4699  e = ::TypeCheck(e);
4700 
4701  const Type *exprType;
4702  if (e == NULL || (exprType = e->GetType()) == NULL)
4703  return NULL;
4704 
4705  const ReferenceType *referenceType = CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType);
4706  if (referenceType != NULL) {
4707  e = new RefDerefExpr(e, e->pos);
4708  exprType = e->GetType();
4709  Assert(exprType != NULL);
4710  }
4711 
4712  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
4713  if (pointerType != NULL)
4714  exprType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
4715 
4716  if (derefLValue == true && pointerType == NULL) {
4717  const Type *targetType = exprType->GetReferenceTarget();
4718  if (CastType<StructType>(targetType) != NULL)
4719  Error(p,
4720  "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-pointer "
4721  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \".\"?",
4722  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4723  else
4724  Error(p,
4725  "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-struct "
4726  "pointer type \"%s\".",
4727  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4728  return NULL;
4729  }
4730  if (derefLValue == false && pointerType != NULL && CastType<StructType>(pointerType->GetBaseType()) != NULL) {
4731  Error(p,
4732  "Member operator \".\" can't be applied to pointer "
4733  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \"->\"?",
4734  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4735  return NULL;
4736  }
4737  if (CastType<StructType>(exprType) != NULL) {
4738  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(exprType);
4739  if (st->IsDefined()) {
4740  return new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
4741  } else {
4742  Error(p,
4743  "Member operator \"%s\" can't be applied to declared "
4744  "struct \"%s\" containing an undefined struct type.",
4745  derefLValue ? "->" : ".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
4746  return NULL;
4747  }
4748  } else if (CastType<VectorType>(exprType) != NULL)
4749  return new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
4750  else if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(exprType)) {
4751  Error(p,
4752  "Member operator \"%s\" can't be applied to declared "
4753  "but not defined struct type \"%s\".",
4754  derefLValue ? "->" : ".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
4755  return NULL;
4756  } else {
4757  Error(p,
4758  "Member operator \"%s\" can't be used with expression of "
4759  "\"%s\" type.",
4760  derefLValue ? "->" : ".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
4761  return NULL;
4762  }
4763 }
4764 
4765 MemberExpr::MemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue, unsigned scid)
4766  : Expr(p, scid), identifierPos(idpos) {
4767  expr = e;
4768  identifier = id;
4769  dereferenceExpr = derefLValue;
4770  type = lvalueType = NULL;
4771 }
4772 
4773 llvm::Value *MemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4774  if (!expr)
4775  return NULL;
4776 
4777  llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
4778  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
4779 
4780  llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
4781  if (lvalue == NULL) {
4782  if (m->errorCount > 0)
4783  return NULL;
4784 
4785  // As in the array case, this may be a temporary that hasn't hit
4786  // memory; get the full value and stuff it into a temporary array
4787  // so that we can index from there...
4788  llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
4789  if (!val) {
4790  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4791  return NULL;
4792  }
4793  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4794  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
4795  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType->LLVMType(g->ctx), "struct_tmp");
4796  ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
4797 
4798  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
4799  if (elementNumber == -1)
4800  return NULL;
4801 
4802  lvalue = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, elementNumber, PointerType::GetUniform(exprType));
4803  lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(GetType());
4804  mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
4805  } else {
4806  Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
4807  AssertPos(pos, baseSym != NULL);
4808  mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
4809  }
4810 
4811  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4812  std::string suffix = std::string("_") + identifier;
4813  return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, lvalueType, LLVMGetName(lvalue, suffix.c_str()));
4814 }
4815 
4816 const Type *MemberExpr::GetType() const { return NULL; }
4817 
4818 Symbol *MemberExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL; }
4819 
4820 int MemberExpr::getElementNumber() const { return -1; }
4821 
4822 llvm::Value *MemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4823  const Type *exprType;
4824  if (!expr || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL))
4825  return NULL;
4826 
4827  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4828  llvm::Value *basePtr = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetValue(ctx) : expr->GetLValue(ctx);
4829  if (!basePtr)
4830  return NULL;
4831 
4832  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
4833  if (elementNumber == -1)
4834  return NULL;
4835 
4836  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() : expr->GetLValueType();
4837  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4838  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, elementNumber, exprLValueType, basePtr->getName().str().c_str());
4839  if (ptr == NULL) {
4840  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4841  return NULL;
4842  }
4843 
4844  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
4845 
4846  return ptr;
4847 }
4848 
4849 Expr *MemberExpr::TypeCheck() { return expr ? this : NULL; }
4850 
4851 Expr *MemberExpr::Optimize() { return expr ? this : NULL; }
4852 
4853 int MemberExpr::EstimateCost() const {
4854  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
4855  if (lvalueType != NULL && lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
4856  return COST_GATHER + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
4857  else
4858  return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
4859 }
4860 
4861 void MemberExpr::Print() const {
4862  if (!expr || !GetType())
4863  return;
4864 
4865  printf("[%s] member (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
4866  expr->Print();
4867  printf(" . %s)", identifier.c_str());
4868  pos.Print();
4869 }
4870 
4871 /** There is no structure member with the name we've got in "identifier".
4872  Use the approximate string matching routine to see if the identifier is
4873  a minor misspelling of one of the ones that is there.
4874  */
4875 std::string MemberExpr::getCandidateNearMatches() const {
4876  const StructType *structType = CastType<StructType>(expr->GetType());
4877  if (!structType)
4878  return "";
4879 
4880  std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
4881  for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
4882  elementNames.push_back(structType->GetElementName(i));
4883  std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(identifier, elementNames);
4884  if (!alternates.size())
4885  return "";
4886 
4887  std::string ret = " Did you mean ";
4888  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
4889  ret += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
4890  if (i < alternates.size() - 1)
4891  ret += ", or ";
4892  }
4893  ret += "?";
4894  return ret;
4895 }
4896 
4897 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4898 // ConstExpr
4899 
4900 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t i, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ConstExprID) {
4901  type = t;
4902  type = type->GetAsConstType();
4903  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()));
4904  int8Val[0] = i;
4905 }
4906 
4907 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t *i, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ConstExprID) {
4908  type = t;
4909  type = type->GetAsConstType();
4910  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()) ||
4911  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8->GetAsConstType()));
4912  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
4913  int8Val[j] = i[j];
4914 }
4915

4918  type = type->GetAsConstType();
4919  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8->GetAsConstType()));
4920  uint8Val[0] = u;
4921 }

4928  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)

4984  (CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL && type->IsUniformType()));
4985  uint32Val[0] = u;
4986 }

4992  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32->GetAsConstType()) ||
4993  (CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL));
4994  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
4995  uint32Val[j] = u[j];
4996 }

5000  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5001  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat->GetAsConstType()));
5002  floatVal[0] = f;
5003 }

5059  doubleVal[j] = f[j];

5062 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, bool b, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ConstExprID) {
5063  type = t;
5064  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5065  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool->GetAsConstType()));
5066  boolVal[0] = b;
5067 }
5068 
5069 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, bool *b, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ConstExprID) {
5070  type = t;
5071  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5072  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool->GetAsConstType()) ||
5073  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool->GetAsConstType()));
5074  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5075  boolVal[j] = b[j];
5076 }
5077 
5078 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, double *v) : Expr(old->pos, ConstExprID) {
5079  type = old->type;
5080 
5081  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5082 
5083  switch (basicType) {
5084  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5085  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5086  boolVal[i] = (v[i] != 0.);
5087  break;
5088  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5089  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5090  int8Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5091  break;
5092  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5093  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5094  uint8Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5095  break;
5096  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5097  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5098  int16Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5099  break;
5100  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5101  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5102  uint16Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5103  break;
5104  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5105  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5106  int32Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5107  break;
5108  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5109  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5110  uint32Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5111  break;
5112  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5113  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5114  floatVal[i] = (float)v[i];
5115  break;
5116  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5117  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5118  doubleVal[i] = v[i];
5119  break;
5120  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5121  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5122  // For now, this should never be reached
5123  FATAL("fixme; we need another constructor so that we're not trying to pass "
5124  "double values to init an int64 type...");
5125  default:
5126  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5127  }
5128 }
5129 
5130 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ConstExprID) {
5131  type = old->type;
5132 
5133  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5134 
5135  switch (basicType) {
5136  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5137  memcpy(boolVal, old->boolVal, Count() * sizeof(bool));
5138  break;
5139  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5140  memcpy(int8Val, old->int8Val, Count() * sizeof(int8_t));
5141  break;
5142  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5143  memcpy(uint8Val, old->uint8Val, Count() * sizeof(uint8_t));
5144  break;
5145  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5146  memcpy(int16Val, old->int16Val, Count() * sizeof(int16_t));
5147  break;
5148  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5149  memcpy(uint16Val, old->uint16Val, Count() * sizeof(uint16_t));
5150  break;
5151  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5152  memcpy(int32Val, old->int32Val, Count() * sizeof(int32_t));
5153  break;
5154  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5155  memcpy(uint32Val, old->uint32Val, Count() * sizeof(uint32_t));
5156  break;
5157  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5158  memcpy(floatVal, old->floatVal, Count() * sizeof(float));
5159  break;
5160  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5161  memcpy(doubleVal, old->doubleVal, Count() * sizeof(double));
5162  break;
5163  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5164  memcpy(int64Val, old->int64Val, Count() * sizeof(int64_t));
5165  break;
5166  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5167  memcpy(uint64Val, old->uint64Val, Count() * sizeof(uint64_t));
5168  break;
5169  default:
5170  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5171  }
5172 }
5173 
5174 AtomicType::BasicType ConstExpr::getBasicType() const {
5175  const AtomicType *at = CastType<AtomicType>(type);
5176  if (at != NULL)
5177  return at->basicType;
5178  else {
5179  AssertPos(pos, CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL);
5180  return AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
5181  }
5182 }
5183 
5184 const Type *ConstExpr::GetType() const { return type; }
5185 
5186 llvm::Value *ConstExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5187  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5188  bool isVarying = type->IsVaryingType();
5189 
5190  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5191 
5192  switch (basicType) {
5193  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5194  if (isVarying)
5195  return LLVMBoolVector(boolVal);
5196  else
5197  return boolVal[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
5198  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5199  return isVarying ? LLVMInt8Vector(int8Val) : LLVMInt8(int8Val[0]);
5200  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5201  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt8Vector(uint8Val) : LLVMUInt8(uint8Val[0]);
5202  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5203  return isVarying ? LLVMInt16Vector(int16Val) : LLVMInt16(int16Val[0]);
5204  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5205  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt16Vector(uint16Val) : LLVMUInt16(uint16Val[0]);
5206  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5207  return isVarying ? LLVMInt32Vector(int32Val) : LLVMInt32(int32Val[0]);
5208  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5209  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32Val) : LLVMUInt32(uint32Val[0]);
5210  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5211  return isVarying ? LLVMFloatVector(floatVal) : LLVMFloat(floatVal[0]);
5212  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5213  return isVarying ? LLVMInt64Vector(int64Val) : LLVMInt64(int64Val[0]);
5214  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5215  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64Val) : LLVMUInt64(uint64Val[0]);
5216  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5217  return isVarying ? LLVMDoubleVector(doubleVal) : LLVMDouble(doubleVal[0]);
5218  default:
5219  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5220  return NULL;
5221  }
5222 }
5223 
5224 /* Type conversion templates: take advantage of C++ function overloading
5225  rules to get the one we want to match. */
5226 
5227 /* First the most general case, just use C++ type conversion if nothing
5228  else matches */
5229 template <typename From, typename To> static inline void lConvertElement(From from, To *to) { *to = (To)from; }
5230 
5231 /** When converting from bool types to numeric types, make sure the result
5232  is one or zero.
5233  */
5234 template <typename To> static inline void lConvertElement(bool from, To *to) { *to = from ? (To)1 : (To)0; }
5235 
5236 /** When converting numeric types to bool, compare to zero. (Do we
5237  actually need this one??) */
5238 template <typename From> static inline void lConvertElement(From from, bool *to) { *to = (from != 0); }
5239 
5240 /** And bool -> bool is just assignment */
5241 static inline void lConvertElement(bool from, bool *to) { *to = from; }
5242 
5243 /** Type conversion utility function
5244  */
5245 template <typename From, typename To> static void lConvert(const From *from, To *to, int count, bool forceVarying) {
5246  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
5247  lConvertElement(from[i], &to[i]);
5248 
5249  if (forceVarying && count == 1)
5250  for (int i = 1; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i)
5251  to[i] = to[0];
5252 }
5253 
5254 int ConstExpr::GetValues(int64_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5255  switch (getBasicType()) {
5256  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5257  lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5258  break;
5259  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5260  lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5261  break;
5262  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5263  lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5264  break;
5265  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5266  lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5267  break;
5268  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5269  lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5270  break;
5271  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5272  lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5273  break;
5274  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5275  lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5276  break;
5277  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5278  lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5279  break;
5280  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5281  lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5282  break;
5283  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5284  lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5285  break;
5286  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5287  lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5288  break;
5289  default:
5290  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5291  }
5292  return Count();
5293 }
5294 
5295 int ConstExpr::GetValues(uint64_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5296  switch (getBasicType()) {
5297  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5298  lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5299  break;
5300  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5301  lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5302  break;
5303  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5304  lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5305  break;
5306  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5307  lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5308  break;
5309  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5310  lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5311  break;
5312  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5313  lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5314  break;
5315  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5316  lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5317  break;
5318  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5319  lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5320  break;
5321  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5322  lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5323  break;
5324  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5325  lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5326  break;
5327  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5328  lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5329  break;
5330  default:
5331  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5332  }
5333  return Count();
5334 }
5335 
5336 int ConstExpr::GetValues(double *d, bool forceVarying) const {
5337  switch (getBasicType()) {
5338  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5339  lConvert(boolVal, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5340  break;
5341  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5342  lConvert(int8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5343  break;
5344  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5345  lConvert(uint8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5346  break;
5347  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5348  lConvert(int16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5349  break;
5350  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5351  lConvert(uint16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5352  break;
5353  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5354  lConvert(int32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5355  break;
5356  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5357  lConvert(uint32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5358  break;
5359  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5360  lConvert(floatVal, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5361  break;
5362  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5363  lConvert(doubleVal, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5364  break;
5365  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5366  lConvert(int64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5367  break;
5368  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5369  lConvert(uint64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying);
5370  break;
5371  default:
5372  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5373  }
5374  return Count();
5375 }

5377 int ConstExpr::GetValues(float *fp, bool forceVarying) const {
5378  switch (getBasicType()) {
5379  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5380  lConvert(boolVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5381  break;
5382  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5383  lConvert(int8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5384  break;
5385  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5386  lConvert(uint8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5387  break;
5388  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5389  lConvert(int16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5390  break;
5391  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5392  lConvert(uint16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5393  break;
5394  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5395  lConvert(int32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5396  break;
5397  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5398  lConvert(uint32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5399  break;
5400  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5401  lConvert(floatVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5402  break;
5403  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5404  lConvert(doubleVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5405  break;
5406  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5407  lConvert(int64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5408  break;
5409  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5410  lConvert(uint64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying);
5411  break;
5412  default:
5413  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5414  }
5415  return Count();
5416 }

5418 int ConstExpr::GetValues(bool *b, bool forceVarying) const {
5419  switch (getBasicType()) {
5420  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5421  lConvert(boolVal, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5422  break;
5423  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5424  lConvert(int8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5425  break;
5426  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5427  lConvert(uint8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5428  break;
5429  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5430  lConvert(int16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5431  break;
5432  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5433  lConvert(uint16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5434  break;
5435  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5436  lConvert(int32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5437  break;
5438  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5439  lConvert(uint32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5440  break;
5441  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5442  lConvert(floatVal, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5443  break;
5444  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5445  lConvert(doubleVal, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5446  break;
5447  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5448  lConvert(int64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5449  break;
5450  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5451  lConvert(uint64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying);
5452  break;
5453  default:
5454  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5455  }
5456  return Count();

5459 int ConstExpr::GetValues(int8_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5460  switch (getBasicType()) {
5461  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5462  lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5463  break;
5464  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5465  lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5466  break;
5467  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5468  lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5469  break;
5470  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5471  lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5472  break;
5473  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5474  lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5475  break;
5476  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5477  lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5478  break;
5479  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5480  lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5481  break;
5482  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5483  lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5484  break;
5485  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5486  lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5487  break;
5488  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5489  lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5490  break;
5491  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5492  lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5493  break;
5494  default:
5495  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5496  }
5497  return Count();
5498 }

5500 int ConstExpr::GetValues(uint8_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5501  switch (getBasicType()) {
5502  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5503  lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5504  break;
5505  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5506  lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5507  break;
5508  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5509  lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5510  break;
5511  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5512  lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5513  break;
5514  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5515  lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5516  break;
5517  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5518  lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5519  break;
5520  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5521  lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5522  break;
5523  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5524  lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5525  break;
5526  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5527  lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5528  break;
5529  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5530  lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5531  break;
5532  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5533  lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5534  break;
5535  default:
5536  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5537  }
5538  return Count();
5539 }

5541 int ConstExpr::GetValues(int16_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5542  switch (getBasicType()) {
5543  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5544  lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5545  break;
5546  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5547  lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5548  break;
5549  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5550  lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5551  break;
5552  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5553  lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5554  break;
5555  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5556  lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5557  break;
5558  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5559  lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5560  break;
5561  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5562  lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5563  break;
5564  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5565  lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5566  break;
5567  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5568  lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5569  break;
5570  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5571  lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5572  break;
5573  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5574  lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5575  break;
5576  default:
5577  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5578  }
5579  return Count();
5580 }

5582 int ConstExpr::GetValues(uint16_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5583  switch (getBasicType()) {
5584  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5585  lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5586  break;
5587  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5588  lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5589  break;
5590  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5591  lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5592  break;
5593  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5594  lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5595  break;
5596  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5597  lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5598  break;
5599  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5600  lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5601  break;
5602  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5603  lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5604  break;
5605  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5606  lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5607  break;
5608  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5609  lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5610  break;
5611  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5612  lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5613  break;
5614  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5615  lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5616  break;
5617  default:
5618  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5619  }
5620  return Count();
5621 }

5623 int ConstExpr::GetValues(int32_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5624  switch (getBasicType()) {
5625  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5626  lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5627  break;
5628  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5629  lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5630  break;
5631  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5632  lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5633  break;
5634  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5635  lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5636  break;
5637  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5638  lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5639  break;
5640  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5641  lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5642  break;
5643  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5644  lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5645  break;
5646  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5647  lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5648  break;
5649  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5650  lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5651  break;
5652  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5653  lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5654  break;
5655  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5656  lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying);
5657  break;
5658  default:
5659  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5660  }
5661  return Count();
5662 }
5663 
5664 int ConstExpr::GetValues(uint32_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5665  switch (getBasicType()) {
5666  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5667  lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5668  break;
5669  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5670  lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5671  break;
5672  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5673  lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5674  break;
5675  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5676  lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5677  break;
5678  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5679  lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5680  break;
5681  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5682  lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5683  break;
5684  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5685  lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5686  break;
5687  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5688  lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5689  break;
5690  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5691  lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5692  break;
5693  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5694  lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5695  break;
5696  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5697  lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying);
5698  break;
5699  default:
5700  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5701  }
5702  return Count();
5703 }
5704 
5705 int ConstExpr::Count() const { return GetType()->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() : 1; }
5706 
5707 llvm::Constant *ConstExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
5708  // Caller shouldn't be trying to stuff a varying value here into a
5709  // constant type.
5710  if (type->IsUniformType())
5711  AssertPos(pos, Count() == 1);
5712 
5713  type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
5714  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
5715  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5716  GetValues(bv, type->IsVaryingType());
5717  if (type->IsUniformType())
5718  return bv[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
5719  else
5720  return LLVMBoolVector(bv);
5721  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
5722  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5723  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5724  if (type->IsUniformType())
5725  return LLVMInt8(iv[0]);
5726  else
5727  return LLVMInt8Vector(iv);
5728  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
5729  uint8_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5730  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5731  if (type->IsUniformType())
5732  return LLVMUInt8(uiv[0]);
5733  else
5734  return LLVMUInt8Vector(uiv);
5735  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt16) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
5736  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5737  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5738  if (type->IsUniformType())
5739  return LLVMInt16(iv[0]);
5740  else
5741  return LLVMInt16Vector(iv);
5742  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
5743  uint16_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5744  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5745  if (type->IsUniformType())
5746  return LLVMUInt16(uiv[0]);
5747  else
5748  return LLVMUInt16Vector(uiv);
5749  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
5750  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5751  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5752  if (type->IsUniformType())
5753  return LLVMInt32(iv[0]);
5754  else
5755  return LLVMInt32Vector(iv);
5756  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
5757  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL) {
5758  uint32_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5759  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5760  if (type->IsUniformType())
5761  return LLVMUInt32(uiv[0]);
5762  else
5763  return LLVMUInt32Vector(uiv);
5764  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
5765  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5766  GetValues(fv, type->IsVaryingType());
5767  if (type->IsUniformType())
5768  return LLVMFloat(fv[0]);
5769  else
5770  return LLVMFloatVector(fv);
5771  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
5772  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5773  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5774  if (type->IsUniformType())
5775  return LLVMInt64(iv[0]);
5776  else
5777  return LLVMInt64Vector(iv);
5778  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
5779  uint64_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5780  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5781  if (type->IsUniformType())
5782  return LLVMUInt64(uiv[0]);
5783  else
5784  return LLVMUInt64Vector(uiv);
5785  } else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformDouble) || Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
5786  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5787  GetValues(dv, type->IsVaryingType());
5788  if (type->IsUniformType())
5789  return LLVMDouble(dv[0]);
5790  else
5791  return LLVMDoubleVector(dv);
5792  } else if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL) {
5793  // The only time we should get here is if we have an integer '0'
5794  // constant that should be turned into a NULL pointer of the
5795  // appropriate type.
5796  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
5797  if (llvmType == NULL) {
5798  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5799  return NULL;
5800  }
5801 
5802  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5803  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5804  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5805  if (iv[i] != 0)
5806  // We'll issue an error about this later--trying to assign
5807  // a constant int to a pointer, without a typecast.
5808  return NULL;
5809 
5810  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
5811  } else {
5812  Debug(pos, "Unable to handle type \"%s\" in ConstExpr::GetConstant().", type->GetString().c_str());
5813  return NULL;
5814  }
5815 }
5816 
5817 Expr *ConstExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
5818 
5819 Expr *ConstExpr::TypeCheck() { return this; }
5820 
5821 int ConstExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
5822 
5823 void ConstExpr::Print() const {
5824  printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
5825  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i) {
5826  switch (getBasicType()) {
5827  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5828  printf("%s", boolVal[i] ? "true" : "false");
5829  break;
5830  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5831  printf("%d", (int)int8Val[i]);
5832  break;
5833  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5834  printf("%u", (int)uint8Val[i]);
5835  break;
5836  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5837  printf("%d", (int)int16Val[i]);
5838  break;
5839  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5840  printf("%u", (int)uint16Val[i]);
5841  break;
5842  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5843  printf("%d", int32Val[i]);
5844  break;
5845  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5846  printf("%u", uint32Val[i]);
5847  break;
5848  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5849  printf("%f", floatVal[i]);
5850  break;
5851  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5852  printf("%" PRId64, int64Val[i]);
5853  break;
5854  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5855  printf("%" PRIu64, uint64Val[i]);
5856  break;
5857  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5858  printf("%f", doubleVal[i]);
5859  break;
5860  default:
5861  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5862  }
5863  if (i != Count() - 1)
5864  printf(", ");
5865  }
5866  printf(")");
5867  pos.Print();
5868 }
5869 
5870 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5871 // TypeCastExpr
5872 
5873 TypeCastExpr::TypeCastExpr(const Type *t, Expr *e, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, TypeCastExprID) {
5874  type = t;
5875  expr = e;
5876 }
5877 
5878 /** Handle all the grungy details of type conversion between atomic types.
5879  Given an input value in exprVal of type fromType, convert it to the
5880  llvm::Value with type toType.
5881  */
5882 static llvm::Value *lTypeConvAtomic(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *exprVal, const AtomicType *toType,
5883  const AtomicType *fromType, SourcePos pos) {
5884  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
5885 
5886  std::string opName = exprVal->getName().str();
5887  switch (toType->basicType) {
5888  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5889  opName += "_to_bool";
5890  break;
5891  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5892  opName += "_to_int8";
5893  break;
5894  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5895  opName += "_to_uint8";
5896  break;
5897  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5898  opName += "_to_int16";
5899  break;
5900  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5901  opName += "_to_uint16";
5902  break;
5903  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5904  opName += "_to_int32";
5905  break;
5906  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5907  opName += "_to_uint32";
5908  break;
5909  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5910  opName += "_to_int64";
5911  break;
5912  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5913  opName += "_to_uint64";
5914  break;
5915  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5916  opName += "_to_float";
5917  break;
5918  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5919  opName += "_to_double";
5920  break;
5921  default:
5922  FATAL("Unimplemented");
5923  }
5924  const char *cOpName = opName.c_str();
5925 
5926  switch (toType->basicType) {
5927  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
5928  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::FloatType : LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
5929  switch (fromType->basicType) {
5930  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5931  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
5932  // If we have a bool vector of non-i1 elements, first
5933  // truncate down to a single bit.
5934  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
5935  // And then do an unisgned int->float cast
5936  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
5937  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5938  break;
5939  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5940  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5941  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5942  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5943  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
5944  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5945  break;
5946  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5947  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5948  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5949  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5950  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
5951  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
5952  "Use \"int\" if possible");
5953  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
5954  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5955  break;
5956  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5957  // No-op cast.
5958  cast = exprVal;
5959  break;
5960  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5961  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5962  break;
5963  default:
5964  FATAL("unimplemented");
5965  }
5966  break;
5967  }
5968  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
5969  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType : LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
5970  switch (fromType->basicType) {
5971  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5972  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
5973  // truncate bool vector values to i1s
5974  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
5975  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
5976  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5977  break;
5978  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5979  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5980  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5981  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5982  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
5983  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5984  break;
5985  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5986  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5987  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5988  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5989  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
5990  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5991  break;
5992  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5993  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
5994  break;
5995  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5996  cast = exprVal;
5997  break;
5998  default:
5999  FATAL("unimplemented");
6000  }
6001  break;
6002  }
6003  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
6004  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type : LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6005  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6006  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6007  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6008  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6009  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6010  break;
6011  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6012  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6013  cast = exprVal;
6014  break;
6015  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6016  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6017  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6018  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6019  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6020  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6021  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6022  break;
6023  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6024  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6025  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6026  break;
6027  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6028  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6029  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6030  break;
6031  default:
6032  FATAL("unimplemented");
6033  }
6034  break;
6035  }
6036  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6037  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type : LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6038  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6039  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6040  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6041  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6042  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6043  break;
6044  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6045  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6046  cast = exprVal;
6047  break;
6048  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6049  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6050  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6051  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6052  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6053  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6054  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6055  break;
6056  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6057  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6058  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6059  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6060  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6061  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6062  break;
6063  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6064  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6065  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6066  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6067  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6068  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6069  break;
6070  default:
6071  FATAL("unimplemented");
6072  }
6073  break;
6074  }
6075  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
6076  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type : LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6077  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6078  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6079  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6080  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6081  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6082  break;
6083  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6084  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6085  break;
6086  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6087  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6088  break;
6089  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6090  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6091  cast = exprVal;
6092  break;
6093  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6094  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6095  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6096  break;
6097  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6098  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6099  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6100  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6101  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6102  break;
6103  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6104  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6105  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6106  break;
6107  default:
6108  FATAL("unimplemented");
6109  }
6110  break;
6111  }
6112  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6113  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type : LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6114  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6115  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6116  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6117  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6118  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6119  break;
6120  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6121  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6122  break;
6123  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6124  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6125  break;
6126  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6127  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6128  cast = exprVal;
6129  break;
6130  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6131  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6132  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6133  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6134  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6135  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6136  break;
6137  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6138  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6139  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6140  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6141  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6142  break;
6143  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6144  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6145  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6146  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6147  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6148  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6149  break;
6150  default:
6151  FATAL("unimplemented");
6152  }
6153  break;
6154  }
6155  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
6156  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type : LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6157  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6158  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6159  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6160  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6161  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6162  break;
6163  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6164  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6165  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6166  break;
6167  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6168  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6169  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6170  break;
6171  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6172  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6173  cast = exprVal;
6174  break;
6175  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6176  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6177  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6178  break;
6179  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6180  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6181  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6182  break;
6183  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6184  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6185  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6186  break;
6187  default:
6188  FATAL("unimplemented");
6189  }
6190  break;
6191  }
6192  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6193  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type : LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6194  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6195  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6196  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6197  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6198  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6199  break;
6200  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6201  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6202  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6203  break;
6204  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6205  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6206  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6207  break;
6208  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6209  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6210  cast = exprVal;
6211  break;
6212  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6213  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6214  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6215  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6216  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6217  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6218  break;
6219  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6220  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6221  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6222  break;
6223  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6224  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6225  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6226  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6227  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6228  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6229  break;
6230  default:
6231  FATAL("unimplemented");
6232  }
6233  break;
6234  }
6235  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
6236  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6237  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6238  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6239  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6240  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6241  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6242  break;
6243  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6244  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6245  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6246  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6247  break;
6248  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6249  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6250  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6251  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6252  break;
6253  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6254  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6255  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6256  break;
6257  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6258  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6259  cast = exprVal;
6260  break;
6261  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6262  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6263  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6264  break;
6265  default:
6266  FATAL("unimplemented");
6267  }
6268  break;
6269  }
6270  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6271  llvm::Type *targetType = fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6272  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6273  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6274  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6275  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6276  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6277  break;
6278  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6279  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6280  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6281  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6282  break;
6283  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6284  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6285  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6286  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6287  break;
6288  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6289  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6290  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6291  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6292  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6293  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6294  break;
6295  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6296  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6297  cast = exprVal;
6298  break;
6299  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6300  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6301  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6302  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6303  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6304  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6305  break;
6306  default:
6307  FATAL("unimplemented");
6308  }
6309  break;
6310  }
6311  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
6312  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6313  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6314  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType) {
6315  // truncate bool vector values to i1s
6316  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6317  }
6318  cast = exprVal;
6319  break;
6320  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6321  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6322  llvm::Value *zero =
6323  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
6324  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6325  break;
6326  }
6327  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6328  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6329  llvm::Value *zero =
6330  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
6331  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6332  break;
6333  }
6334  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6335  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6336  llvm::Value *zero =
6337  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
6338  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6339  break;
6340  }
6341  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6342  llvm::Value *zero =
6343  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
6344  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6345  break;
6346  }
6347  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6348  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6349  llvm::Value *zero =
6350  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
6351  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6352  break;
6353  }
6354  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6355  llvm::Value *zero =
6356  fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) : (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
6357  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE, exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6358  break;
6359  }
6360  default:
6361  FATAL("unimplemented");
6362  }
6363 
6364  if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6365  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType) {
6366  // extend out to an bool as an i8/i16/i32 from the i1 here.
6367  // Then we'll turn that into a vector below, the way it
6368  // does for everyone else...
6369  cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(), LLVMGetName(cast, "to_i_bool"));
6370  }
6371  } else {
6372  // fromType->IsVaryingType())
6373  cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
6374  }
6375  break;
6376  }
6377  default:
6378  FATAL("unimplemented");
6379  }
6380 
6381  // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
6382  // value across the vector elements..
6383  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6384  return ctx->SmearUniform(cast);
6385  else
6386  return cast;
6387 }
6388 
6389 // FIXME: fold this into the FunctionEmitContext::SmearUniform() method?
6390 
6391 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
6392  equivalent, returning the resulting value.
6393  */
6394 static llvm::Value *lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value, const Type *type,
6395  SourcePos pos) {
6396  // nothing to do if it's already varying
6397  if (type->IsVaryingType())
6398  return value;
6399 
6400  // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
6401  // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
6402  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
6403  if (collectionType != NULL) {
6404  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6405  llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
6406 
6407  const StructType *structType = CastType<StructType>(type->GetAsVaryingType());
6408 
6409  for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6410  llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
6411  // If struct has "bound uniform" member, we don't need to cast it to varying
6412  if (!(structType != NULL && structType->GetElementType(i)->IsUniformType()))
6413  v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i), pos);
6414  retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
6415  }
6416  return retValue;
6417  }
6418 
6419  // Otherwise we must have a uniform atomic or pointer type, so smear
6420  // its value across the vector lanes.
6421  if (CastType<AtomicType>(type)) {
6422  return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, value, CastType<AtomicType>(type->GetAsVaryingType()), CastType<AtomicType>(type),
6423  pos);
6424  }
6425 
6426  Assert(CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
6427  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6428 }
6429 
6430 llvm::Value *TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6431  if (!expr)
6432  return NULL;
6433 
6434  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
6435  const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
6436  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL) {
6437  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6438  return NULL;
6439  }
6440 
6441  if (toType->IsVoidType()) {
6442  // emit the code for the expression in case it has side-effects but
6443  // then we're done.
6444  (void)expr->GetValue(ctx);
6445  return NULL;
6446  }
6447 
6448  const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
6449  const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
6450  const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
6451  const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
6452  if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
6453  if (toArrayType != NULL) {
6454  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6455  } else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
6456  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6457  if (value == NULL)
6458  return NULL;
6459 
6460  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false && toPointerType->IsSlice() == true) {
6461  // Convert from a non-slice pointer to a slice pointer by
6462  // creating a slice pointer structure with zero offsets.
6463  if (fromPointerType->IsUniformType())
6464  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32(0));
6465  else
6466  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32Vector(0));
6467 
6468  // FIXME: avoid error from unnecessary bitcast when all we
6469  // need to do is the slice conversion and don't need to
6470  // also do unif->varying conversions. But this is really
6471  // ugly logic.
6472  if (value->getType() == toType->LLVMType(g->ctx))
6473  return value;
6474  }
6475 
6476  if (fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsUniformType())
6477  // bitcast to the actual pointer type
6478  return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6479  else if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6480  // both are vectors of ints already, nothing to do at the IR
6481  // level
6482  return value;
6483  } else {
6484  // Uniform -> varying pointer conversion
6485  AssertPos(pos, fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsVaryingType());
6486  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice()) {
6487  // For slice pointers, we need to smear out both the
6488  // pointer and the offset vector
6489  AssertPos(pos, toPointerType->IsSlice());
6490  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 0);
6491  llvm::Value *offset = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 1);
6492  ptr = ctx->PtrToIntInst(ptr);
6493  ptr = ctx->SmearUniform(ptr);
6494  offset = ctx->SmearUniform(offset);
6495  return ctx->MakeSlicePointer(ptr, offset);
6496  } else {
6497  // Otherwise we just bitcast it to an int and smear it
6498  // out to a vector
6499  value = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value);
6500  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6501  }
6502  }
6503  } else {
6504  AssertPos(pos, CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL);
6505  if (toType->IsBoolType()) {
6506  // convert pointer to bool
6507  llvm::Type *lfu = fromType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6508  llvm::PointerType *llvmFromUnifType = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::PointerType>(lfu);
6509 
6510  llvm::Value *nullPtrValue = llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(llvmFromUnifType);
6511  if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
6512  nullPtrValue = ctx->SmearUniform(nullPtrValue);
6513 
6514  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6515  llvm::Value *cmp =
6516  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, exprVal, nullPtrValue, "ptr_ne_NULL");
6517 
6518  if (toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6519  if (fromType->IsUniformType())
6520  cmp = ctx->SmearUniform(cmp);
6521  cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
6522  }
6523 
6524  return cmp;
6525  } else {
6526  // ptr -> int
6527  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6528  if (value == NULL)
6529  return NULL;
6530 
6531  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6532  value = ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6533 
6534  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6535  if (llvmToType == NULL)
6536  return NULL;
6537  return ctx->PtrToIntInst(value, llvmToType, "ptr_typecast");
6538  }
6539  }
6540  }
6541 
6542  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType))
6543  // There's nothing to do, just return the value. (LLVM's type
6544  // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
6545  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6546 
6547  if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
6548  // implicit array to pointer to first element
6549  Expr *arrayAsPtr = lArrayToPointer(expr);
6550  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType) == false) {
6551  AssertPos(pos,
6552  PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType) ||
6553  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType()->GetAsVaryingType(), toPointerType) == true);
6554  arrayAsPtr = new TypeCastExpr(toPointerType, arrayAsPtr, pos);
6555  arrayAsPtr = ::TypeCheck(arrayAsPtr);
6556  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6557  arrayAsPtr = ::Optimize(arrayAsPtr);
6558  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6559  }
6560  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType));
6561  return arrayAsPtr->GetValue(ctx);
6562  }
6563 
6564  // This also should be caught during typechecking
6565  AssertPos(pos, !(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
6566 
6567  if (toArrayType != NULL && fromArrayType != NULL) {
6568  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6569  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6570  if (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != 0 && (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount()))
6571  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d", fromArrayType->GetElementCount(),
6572  toArrayType->GetElementCount());
6573  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArrayType->GetBaseType(), fromArrayType->GetBaseType()));
6574  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6575  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6576  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6577  }
6578 
6579  const ReferenceType *toReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(toType);
6580  const ReferenceType *fromReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType);
6581  if (toReference && fromReference) {
6582  const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6583  const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6584 
6585  const ArrayType *toArray = CastType<ArrayType>(toTarget);
6586  const ArrayType *fromArray = CastType<ArrayType>(fromTarget);
6587  if (toArray && fromArray) {
6588  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6589  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6590  if (toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 && (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
6591  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d", fromArray->GetElementCount(),
6592  toArray->GetElementCount());
6593  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArray->GetBaseType(), fromArray->GetBaseType()));
6594  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6595  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6596  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6597  }
6598 
6599  // Just bitcast it. See Issue #721
6600  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6601  return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx), "refcast");
6602  }
6603 
6604  const StructType *toStruct = CastType<StructType>(toType);
6605  const StructType *fromStruct = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
6606  if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
6607  // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
