6608  // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
6609  AssertPos(pos, toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
6610  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toStruct, fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
6611 
6612  llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6613  if (!origValue)
6614  return NULL;
6615  return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType, pos);
6616  }
6617 
6618  const VectorType *toVector = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
6619  const VectorType *fromVector = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
6620  if (toVector && fromVector) {
6621  // this should be caught during typechecking
6622  AssertPos(pos, toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
6623 
6624  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6625  if (!exprVal)
6626  return NULL;
6627 
6628  // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
6629  // of the vector.
6630  // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
6631  // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
6632  // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
6633  // efficient by avoiding serialization!
6634  llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6635  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6636  llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
6637 
6638  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(), fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
6639  if (!conv)
6640  return NULL;
6641  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
6642  }
6643  return cast;
6644  }
6645 
6646  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6647  if (!exprVal)
6648  return NULL;
6649 
6650  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
6651  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6652  if (fromEnum)
6653  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
6654  fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
6655  if (toEnum)
6656  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
6657  toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
6658 
6659  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
6660  // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
6661  AssertPos(pos, fromAtomic != NULL);
6662 
6663  if (toVector) {
6664  // scalar -> short vector conversion
6665  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(), fromAtomic, pos);
6666  if (!conv)
6667  return NULL;
6668 
6669  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
6670  llvm::Type *toTypeLLVM = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6671  if (llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
6672  // Example uniform float => uniform float<3>
6673  cast = ctx->BroadcastValue(conv, toTypeLLVM);
6674  } else if (llvm::isa<llvm::ArrayType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
6675  // Example varying float => varying float<3>
6676  cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6677  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6678  // Here's InsertInst produces InsertValueInst.
6679  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
6680  }
6681  } else {
6682  FATAL("TypeCastExpr::GetValue: problem with cast");
6683  }
6684 
6685  return cast;
6686  } else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
6687  // int -> ptr
6688  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6689  exprVal = ctx->SmearUniform(exprVal);
6690 
6691  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6692  if (llvmToType == NULL)
6693  return NULL;
6694 
6695  return ctx->IntToPtrInst(exprVal, llvmToType, "int_to_ptr");
6696  } else {
6697  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6698  // typechecking should ensure this is the case
6699  AssertPos(pos, toAtomic != NULL);
6700 
6701  return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
6702  }
6703 }
6704 
6705 llvm::Value *TypeCastExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6706  if (GetLValueType() != NULL) {
6707  return GetValue(ctx);
6708  } else {
6709  return NULL;
6710  }
6711 }
6712 
6713 const Type *TypeCastExpr::GetType() const {
6714  // Here we try to resolve situation where (base_type) can be treated as
6715  // (uniform base_type) of (varying base_type). This is a part of function
6716  // TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck. After implementation of operators we
6717  // have to have this functionality here.
6718  const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
6719  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
6720  return NULL;
6721  if (toType->HasUnboundVariability()) {
6722  if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6723  toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
6724  } else {
6725  toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
6726  }
6727  }
6728  AssertPos(pos, toType->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
6729  return toType;
6730 }
6731 
6732 const Type *TypeCastExpr::GetLValueType() const {
6733  AssertPos(pos, type->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
6734  if (CastType<PointerType>(GetType()) != NULL) {
6735  return type;
6736  } else {
6737  return NULL;
6738  }
6739 }
6740 
6741 static const Type *lDeconstifyType(const Type *t) {
6742  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(t);
6743  if (pt != NULL)
6744  return new PointerType(lDeconstifyType(pt->GetBaseType()), pt->GetVariability(), false);
6745  else
6746  return t->GetAsNonConstType();
6747 }
6748 
6749 Expr *TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
6750  if (expr == NULL)
6751  return NULL;
6752 
6753  const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
6754  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
6755  return NULL;
6756 
6757  if (toType->HasUnboundVariability() && fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6758  TypeCastExpr *tce = new TypeCastExpr(toType->GetAsUniformType(), expr, pos);
6759  return ::TypeCheck(tce);
6760  }
6761  type = toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
6762 
6763  fromType = lDeconstifyType(fromType);
6764  toType = lDeconstifyType(toType);
6765 
6766  // Anything can be cast to void...
6767  if (toType->IsVoidType())
6768  return this;
6769 
6770  if (fromType->IsVoidType() || (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsUniformType())) {
6771  Error(pos, "Can't type cast from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\"", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
6772  toType->GetString().c_str());
6773  return NULL;
6774  }
6775 
6776  // First some special cases that we allow only with an explicit type cast
6777  const PointerType *fromPtr = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
6778  const PointerType *toPtr = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
6779  if (fromPtr != NULL && toPtr != NULL)
6780  // allow explicit typecasts between any two different pointer types
6781  return this;
6782 
6783  const ReferenceType *fromRef = CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType);
6784  const ReferenceType *toRef = CastType<ReferenceType>(toType);
6785  if (fromRef != NULL && toRef != NULL) {
6786  // allow explicit typecasts between any two different reference types
6787  // Issues #721
6788  return this;
6789  }
6790 
6791  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
6792  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6793  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
6794  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6795  if ((fromAtomic || fromEnum) && (toAtomic || toEnum))
6796  // Allow explicit casts between all of these
6797  return this;
6798 
6799  // ptr -> int type casts
6800  if (fromPtr != NULL && toAtomic != NULL && toAtomic->IsIntType()) {
6801  bool safeCast =
6802  (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 || toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
6803  if (g->target->is32Bit())
6804  safeCast |=
6805  (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 || toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32);
6806  if (safeCast == false)
6807  Warning(pos,
6808  "Pointer type cast of type \"%s\" to integer type "
6809  "\"%s\" may lose information.",
6810  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str());
6811  return this;
6812  }
6813 
6814  // int -> ptr
6815  if (fromAtomic != NULL && fromAtomic->IsIntType() && toPtr != NULL)
6816  return this;
6817 
6818  // And otherwise see if it's one of the conversions allowed to happen
6819  // implicitly.
6820  Expr *e = TypeConvertExpr(expr, toType, "type cast expression");
6821  if (e == NULL)
6822  return NULL;
6823  else
6824  return e;
6825 }
6826 
6827 Expr *TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
6828  ConstExpr *constExpr = llvm::dyn_cast<ConstExpr>(expr);
6829  if (constExpr == NULL)
6830  // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
6831  return this;
6832 
6833  const Type *toType = GetType();
6834  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6835  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6836  // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
6837  // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types. (So
6838  // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
6839  if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
6840  return this;
6841 
6842  bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
6843 
6844  // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
6845  // ConstExpr::GetValues(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
6846  // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
6847  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType : AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
6848  switch (basicType) {
6849  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
6850  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6851  constExpr->GetValues(bv, forceVarying);
6852  return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
6853  }
6854  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
6855  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6856  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
6857  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
6858  }
6859  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6860  uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6861  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
6862  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
6863  }
6864  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
6865  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6866  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
6867  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
6868  }
6869  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6870  uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6871  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
6872  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
6873  }
6874  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
6875  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6876  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
6877  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
6878  }
6879  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6880  uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6881  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
6882  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
6883  }
6884  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6885  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6886  constExpr->GetValues(fv, forceVarying);
6887  return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
6888  }
6889  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
6890  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6891  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
6892  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
6893  }
6894  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6895  uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6896  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
6897  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
6898  }
6899  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6900  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6901  constExpr->GetValues(dv, forceVarying);
6902  return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
6903  }
6904  default:
6905  FATAL("unimplemented");
6906  }
6907  return this;
6908 }
6909 
6910 int TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
6911  if (llvm::dyn_cast<ConstExpr>(expr) != NULL)
6912  return 0;
6913 
6914  // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
6915  return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
6916 }
6917 
6918 void TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
6919  printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
6920  expr->Print();
6921  printf(")");
6922  pos.Print();
6923 }
6924 
6925 Symbol *TypeCastExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL; }
6926 
6927 static llvm::Constant *lConvertPointerConstant(llvm::Constant *c, const Type *constType) {
6928  if (c == NULL || constType->IsUniformType())
6929  return c;
6930 
6931  // Handle conversion to int and then to vector of int or array of int
6932  // (for varying and soa types, respectively)
6933  llvm::Constant *intPtr = llvm::ConstantExpr::getPtrToInt(c, LLVMTypes::PointerIntType);
6934  Assert(constType->IsVaryingType() || constType->IsSOAType());
6935  int count = constType->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() : constType->GetSOAWidth();
6936 
6937  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> smear;
6938  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
6939  smear.push_back(intPtr);
6940 
6941  if (constType->IsVaryingType())
6942  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(smear);
6943  else {
6944  llvm::ArrayType *at = llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::PointerIntType, count);
6945  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(at, smear);
6946  }
6947 }
6948 
6949 llvm::Constant *TypeCastExpr::GetConstant(const Type *constType) const {
6950  // We don't need to worry about most the basic cases where the type
6951  // cast can resolve to a constant here, since the
6952  // TypeCastExpr::Optimize() method generally ends up doing the type
6953  // conversion and returning a ConstExpr, which in turn will have its
6954  // GetConstant() method called. However, because ConstExpr currently
6955  // can't represent pointer values, we have to handle a few cases
6956  // related to pointers here:
6957  //
6958  // 1. Null pointer (NULL, 0) valued initializers
6959  // 2. Converting function types to pointer-to-function types
6960  // 3. And converting these from uniform to the varying/soa equivalents.
6961  //
6962  if (CastType<PointerType>(constType) == NULL)
6963  return NULL;
6964 
6965  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(constType->GetAsUniformType());
6966  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, constType);
6967 }
6968 
6969 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6970 // ReferenceExpr
6971 
6972 ReferenceExpr::ReferenceExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, ReferenceExprID) { expr = e; }
6973 
6974 llvm::Value *ReferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6975  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
6976  if (expr == NULL) {
6977  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6978  return NULL;
6979  }
6980 
6981  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
6982  if (value != NULL)
6983  return value;
6984 
6985  // value is NULL if the expression is a temporary; in this case, we'll
6986  // allocate storage for it so that we can return the pointer to that...
6987  const Type *type;
6988  llvm::Type *llvmType;
6989  if ((type = expr->GetType()) == NULL || (llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx)) == NULL) {
6990  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6991  return NULL;
6992  }
6993 
6994  value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6995  if (value == NULL) {
6996  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6997  return NULL;
6998  }
6999 
7000  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType);
7001  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr);
7002  return ptr;
7003 }
7004 
7005 Symbol *ReferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL; }
7006 
7007 const Type *ReferenceExpr::GetType() const {
7008  if (!expr)
7009  return NULL;
7010 
7011  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7012  if (!type)
7013  return NULL;
7014 
7015  return new ReferenceType(type);
7016 }
7017 
7018 const Type *ReferenceExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7019  if (!expr)
7020  return NULL;
7021 
7022  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7023  if (!type)
7024  return NULL;
7025 
7026  return PointerType::GetUniform(type);
7027 }
7028 
7029 Expr *ReferenceExpr::Optimize() {
7030  if (expr == NULL)
7031  return NULL;
7032  return this;
7033 }
7034 
7035 Expr *ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
7036  if (expr == NULL)
7037  return NULL;
7038  return this;
7039 }
7040 
7041 int ReferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
7042 
7043 void ReferenceExpr::Print() const {
7044  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7045  return;
7046 
7047  printf("[%s] &(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7048  expr->Print();
7049  printf(")");
7050  pos.Print();
7051 }
7052 
7053 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7054 // DerefExpr
7055 
7056 DerefExpr::DerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p, unsigned scid) : Expr(p, scid) { expr = e; }
7057 
7058 llvm::Value *DerefExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7059  if (expr == NULL)
7060  return NULL;
7061  llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7062  if (ptr == NULL)
7063  return NULL;
7064  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7065  if (type == NULL)
7066  return NULL;
7067 
7068  if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(type, pos))
7069  return NULL;
7070 
7071  // If dealing with 'varying * varying' add required offsets.
7072  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, type);
7073 
7074  Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
7075  llvm::Value *mask = baseSym ? lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx) : ctx->GetFullMask();
7076 
7077  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7078  return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, type);
7079 }
7080 
7081 llvm::Value *DerefExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7082  if (expr == NULL)
7083  return NULL;
7084  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7085 }
7086 
7087 const Type *DerefExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7088  if (expr == NULL)
7089  return NULL;
7090  return expr->GetType();
7091 }
7092 
7093 Symbol *DerefExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL; }
7094 
7095 Expr *DerefExpr::Optimize() {
7096  if (expr == NULL)
7097  return NULL;
7098  return this;
7099 }
7100 
7101 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7102 // PtrDerefExpr
7103 
7104 PtrDerefExpr::PtrDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) : DerefExpr(e, p, PtrDerefExprID) {}
7105 
7106 const Type *PtrDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7107  const Type *type;
7108  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7109  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7110  return NULL;
7111  }
7112  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
7113 
7114  if (type->IsUniformType())
7115  return type->GetBaseType();
7116  else
7117  return type->GetBaseType()->GetAsVaryingType();
7118 }
7119 
7120 Expr *PtrDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7121  const Type *type;
7122  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7123  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7124  return NULL;
7125  }
7126 
7127  if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type)) {
7128  if (pt->GetBaseType()->IsVoidType()) {
7129  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
7130  return NULL;
7131  }
7132  } else {
7133  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference non-pointer type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
7134  return NULL;
7135  }
7136 
7137  return this;
7138 }
7139 
7140 int PtrDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7141  const Type *type;
7142  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7143  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7144  return 0;
7145  }
7146 
7147  if (type->IsVaryingType())
7148  // Be pessimistic; some of these will later be optimized into
7149  // vector loads/stores..
7150  return COST_GATHER + COST_DEREF;
7151  else
7152  return COST_DEREF;
7153 }
7154 
7155 void PtrDerefExpr::Print() const {
7156  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7157  return;
7158 
7159  printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7160  expr->Print();
7161  printf(")");
7162  pos.Print();
7163 }
7164 
7165 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7166 // RefDerefExpr
7167 
7168 RefDerefExpr::RefDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) : DerefExpr(e, p, RefDerefExprID) {}
7169 
7170 const Type *RefDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7171  const Type *type;
7172  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7173  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7174  return NULL;
7175  }
7176 
7177  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7178  return type->GetReferenceTarget();
7179 }
7180 
7181 Expr *RefDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7182  const Type *type;
7183  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7184  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7185  return NULL;
7186  }
7187 
7188  // We only create RefDerefExprs internally for references in
7189  // expressions, so we should never create one with a non-reference
7190  // expression...
7191  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7192 
7193  return this;
7194 }
7195 
7196 int RefDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7197  if (expr == NULL)
7198  return 0;
7199 
7200  return COST_DEREF;
7201 }
7202 
7203 void RefDerefExpr::Print() const {
7204  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7205  return;
7206 
7207  printf("[%s] deref-reference (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7208  expr->Print();
7209  printf(")");
7210  pos.Print();
7211 }
7212 
7213 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7214 // AddressOfExpr
7215 
7216 AddressOfExpr::AddressOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, AddressOfExprID), expr(e) {}
7217 
7218 llvm::Value *AddressOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7219  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7220  if (expr == NULL)
7221  return NULL;
7222 
7223  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7224  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL || CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL)
7225  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7226  else
7227  return expr->GetLValue(ctx);
7228 }
7229 
7230 const Type *AddressOfExpr::GetType() const {
7231  if (expr == NULL)
7232  return NULL;
7233 
7234  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7235  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL)
7236  return PointerType::GetUniform(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
7237 
7238  const Type *t = expr->GetLValueType();
7239  if (t != NULL)
7240  return t;
7241  else {
7242  t = expr->GetType();
7243  if (t == NULL) {
7244  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7245  return NULL;
7246  }
7247  return PointerType::GetUniform(t);
7248  }
7249 }
7250 
7251 const Type *AddressOfExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7252  if (!expr)
7253  return NULL;
7254 
7255  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7256  if (!type)
7257  return NULL;
7258 
7259  return PointerType::GetUniform(type);
7260 }
7261 
7262 Symbol *AddressOfExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL; }
7263 
7264 void AddressOfExpr::Print() const {
7265  printf("&(");
7266  if (expr)
7267  expr->Print();
7268  else
7269  printf("NULL expr");
7270  printf(")");
7271  pos.Print();
7272 }
7273 
7274 Expr *AddressOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7275  const Type *exprType;
7276  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7277  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7278  return NULL;
7279  }
7280 
7281  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL || CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL) {
7282  return this;
7283  }
7284 
7285  if (expr->GetLValueType() != NULL)
7286  return this;
7287 
7288  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to take address of non-lvalue or function.");
7289  return NULL;
7290 }
7291 
7292 Expr *AddressOfExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
7293 
7294 int AddressOfExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
7295 
7296 llvm::Constant *AddressOfExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7297  const Type *exprType;
7298  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7299  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7300  return NULL;
7301  }
7302 
7303  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
7304  if (pt == NULL)
7305  return NULL;
7306 
7307  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
7308  if (ft != NULL) {
7309  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(ft);
7310  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, type);
7311  } else
7312  return NULL;
7313 }
7314 
7315 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7316 // SizeOfExpr
7317 
7318 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, SizeOfExprID), expr(e), type(NULL) {}
7319 
7320 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(const Type *t, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, SizeOfExprID), expr(NULL), type(t) {
7321  type = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
7322 }
7323 
7324 llvm::Value *SizeOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7325  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7326  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7327  if (t == NULL)
7328  return NULL;
7329 
7330  llvm::Type *llvmType = t->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7331  if (llvmType == NULL)
7332  return NULL;
7333 
7334  return g->target->SizeOf(llvmType, ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
7335 }
7336 
7337 const Type *SizeOfExpr::GetType() const {
7338  return (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32
7339  : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
7340 }
7341 
7342 void SizeOfExpr::Print() const {
7343  printf("Sizeof (");
7344  if (expr != NULL)
7345  expr->Print();
7346  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7347  if (t != NULL)
7348  printf(" [type %s]", t->GetString().c_str());
7349  printf(")");
7350  pos.Print();
7351 }
7352 
7353 Expr *SizeOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7354  // Can't compute the size of a struct without a definition
7355  if (type != NULL && CastType<UndefinedStructType>(type) != NULL) {
7356  Error(pos,
7357  "Can't compute the size of declared but not defined "
7358  "struct type \"%s\".",
7359  type->GetString().c_str());
7360  return NULL;
7361  }
7362 #ifdef ISPC_NVPTX_ENABLED
7363  if (type != NULL)
7364  if (g->target->getISA() == Target::NVPTX && type->IsVaryingType()) {
7365  Error(pos, "\"sizeof\" with varying data types is not yet supported with \"nvptx\" target.");
7366  return NULL;
7367  }
7368 #endif /* ISPC_NVPTX_ENABLED */
7369 
7370  return this;
7371 }
7372 
7373 Expr *SizeOfExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
7374 
7375 int SizeOfExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
7376 
7377 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7378 // SymbolExpr
7379 
7380 SymbolExpr::SymbolExpr(Symbol *s, SourcePos p) : Expr(p, SymbolExprID) { symbol = s; }
7381 
7382 llvm::Value *SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7383  // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
7384  if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
7385  return NULL;
7386  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7387 
7388  std::string loadName = symbol->name + std::string("_load");
7389  return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, loadName.c_str());
7390 }
7391 
7392 llvm::Value *SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7393  if (symbol == NULL)
7394  return NULL;
7395  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7396  return symbol->storagePtr;
7397 }
7398 
7399 const Type *SymbolExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7400  if (symbol == NULL)
7401  return NULL;
7402 
7403  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(symbol->type) != NULL)
7404  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type->GetReferenceTarget());
7405  else
7406  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type);
7407 }
7408 
7409 Symbol *SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return symbol; }
7410 
7411 const Type *SymbolExpr::GetType() const { return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL; }
7412 
7413 Expr *SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() { return this; }
7414 
7415 Expr *SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
7416  if (symbol == NULL)
7417  return NULL;
7418  else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
7419  AssertPos(pos, GetType()->IsConstType());
7420  return new ConstExpr(symbol->constValue, pos);
7421  } else
7422  return this;
7423 }
7424 
7425 int SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7426  // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
7427  // memory operand..
7428  return 0;
7429 }
7430 
7431 void SymbolExpr::Print() const {
7432  if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7433  return;
7434 
7435  printf("[%s] sym: (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(), symbol->name.c_str());
7436  pos.Print();
7437 }
7438 
7439 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7440 // FunctionSymbolExpr
7441 
7442 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n, const std::vector<Symbol *> &candidates, SourcePos p)
7443  : Expr(p, FunctionSymbolExprID) {
7444  name = n;
7445  candidateFunctions = candidates;
7446  matchingFunc = (candidates.size() == 1) ? candidates[0] : NULL;
7447  triedToResolve = false;
7448 }
7449 
7450 const Type *FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
7451  if (triedToResolve == false && matchingFunc == NULL) {
7452  Error(pos, "Ambiguous use of overloaded function \"%s\".", name.c_str());
7453  return NULL;
7454  }
7455 
7456  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->type : NULL;
7457 }
7458 
7459 llvm::Value *FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7460  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
7461 }
7462 
7463 Symbol *FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const { return matchingFunc; }
7464 
7465 Expr *FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() { return this; }
7466 
7467 Expr *FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
7468 
7469 int FunctionSymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
7470 
7471 void FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
7472  if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
7473  return;
7474 
7475  printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(), matchingFunc->name.c_str());
7476  pos.Print();
7477 }
7478 
7479 llvm::Constant *FunctionSymbolExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7480  if (matchingFunc == NULL || matchingFunc->function == NULL)
7481  return NULL;
7482 
7483  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
7484  if (ft == NULL)
7485  return NULL;
7486 
7487  if (Type::Equal(type, matchingFunc->type) == false) {
7488  Error(pos,
7489  "Type of function symbol \"%s\" doesn't match expected type "
7490  "\"%s\".",
7491  matchingFunc->type->GetString().c_str(), type->GetString().c_str());
7492  return NULL;
7493  }
7494 
7495  return matchingFunc->function;
7496 }
7497 
7498 static std::string lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs,
7499  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
7500  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
7501  std::string message = "Passed types: (";
7502  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
7503  if (argTypes[i] != NULL)
7504  message += argTypes[i]->GetString();
7505  else
7506  message += "(unknown type)";
7507  message += (i < argTypes.size() - 1) ? ", " : ")\n";
7508  }
7509 
7510  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
7511  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(funcs[i]->type);
7512  Assert(ft != NULL);
7513  message += "Candidate: ";
7514  message += ft->GetString();
7515  if (i < funcs.size() - 1)
7516  message += "\n";
7517  }
7518  return message;
7519 }
7520 
7521 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
7522  converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
7523  conversion that won't lose information. Otherwise return false.
7524  */
7525 static bool lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
7526  const AtomicType *callAt = CastType<AtomicType>(callType);
7527  const AtomicType *funcAt = CastType<AtomicType>(funcArgType);
7528  if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
7529  return false;
7530 
7531  if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
7532  return false;
7533 
7534  switch (callAt->basicType) {
7535  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
7536  return true;
7537  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
7538  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
7539  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL);
7540  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
7541  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
7542  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL && funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
7543  funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8);
7544  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
7545  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
7546  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 || funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
7547  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 || funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
7548  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
7549  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE);
7550  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
7551  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
7552  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 || funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
7553  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
7554  return false;
7555  default:
7556  FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
7557  return false;
7558  }
7559 }
7560 
7561 /* Returns the set of function overloads that are potential matches, given
7562  argCount values being passed as arguments to the function call.
7563  */
7564 std::vector<Symbol *> FunctionSymbolExpr::getCandidateFunctions(int argCount) const {
7565  std::vector<Symbol *> ret;
7566  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateFunctions.size(); ++i) {
7567  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(candidateFunctions[i]->type);
7568  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
7569 
7570  // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
7571  // than this function instance takes.
7572  if (argCount > ft->GetNumParameters())
7573  continue;
7574 
7575  // Not enough arguments, and no default argument value to save us
7576  if (argCount < ft->GetNumParameters() && ft->GetParameterDefault(argCount) == NULL)
7577  continue;
7578 
7579  // Success
7580  ret.push_back(candidateFunctions[i]);
7581  }
7582  return ret;
7583 }
7584 
7585 static bool lArgIsPointerType(const Type *type) {
7586  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
7587  return true;
7588 
7589  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
7590  if (rt == NULL)
7591  return false;
7592 
7593  const Type *t = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
7594  return (CastType<PointerType>(t) != NULL);
7595 }
7596 
7597 /** This function computes the value of a cost function that represents the
7598  cost of calling a function of the given type with arguments of the
7599  given types. If it's not possible to call the function, regardless of
7600  any type conversions applied, a cost of -1 is returned.
7601  */
7602 int FunctionSymbolExpr::computeOverloadCost(const FunctionType *ftype, const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
7603  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
7604  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant, int *cost) {
7605  int costSum = 0;
7606 
7607  // In computing the cost function, we only worry about the actual
7608  // argument types--using function default parameter values is free for
7609  // the purposes here...
7610  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
7611  cost[i] = 0;
7612  // The cost imposed by this argument will be a multiple of
7613  // costScale, which has a value set so that for each of the cost
7614  // buckets, even if all of the function arguments undergo the next
7615  // lower-cost conversion, the sum of their costs will be less than
7616  // a single instance of the next higher-cost conversion.
7617  int costScale = argTypes.size() + 1;
7618 
7619  const Type *fargType = ftype->GetParameterType(i);
7620  const Type *callType = argTypes[i];
7621 
7622  if (Type::Equal(callType, fargType))
7623  // Perfect match: no cost
7624  // Step "1" from documentation
7625  cost[i] += 0;
7626  else if (argCouldBeNULL && (*argCouldBeNULL)[i] && lArgIsPointerType(fargType))
7627  // Passing NULL to a pointer-typed parameter is also a no-cost operation
7628  // Step "1" from documentation
7629  cost[i] += 0;
7630  else {
7631  // If the argument is a compile-time constant, we'd like to
7632  // count the cost of various conversions as much lower than the
7633  // cost if it wasn't--so scale up the cost when this isn't the
7634  // case..
7635  if (argIsConstant == NULL || (*argIsConstant)[i] == false)
7636  costScale *= 512;
7637 
7638  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fargType)) {
7639  // Here we completely handle the case where fargType is reference.
7640  if (callType->IsConstType() && !fargType->IsConstType()) {
7641  // It is forbidden to pass const object to non-const reference (cvf -> vfr)
7642  return -1;
7643  }
7644  if (!callType->IsConstType() && fargType->IsConstType()) {
7645  // It is possible to pass (vf -> cvfr)
7646  // but it is worse than (vf -> vfr) or (cvf -> cvfr)
7647  // Step "3" from documentation
7648  cost[i] += 2 * costScale;
7649  }
7650  if (!Type::Equal(callType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsNonConstType(),
7651  fargType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsNonConstType())) {
7652  // Types under references must be equal completely.
7653  // vd -> vfr or vd -> cvfr are forbidden. (Although clang allows vd -> cvfr case.)
7654  return -1;
7655  }
7656  // penalty for equal types under reference (vf -> vfr is worse than vf -> vf)
7657  // Step "2" from documentation
7658  cost[i] += 2 * costScale;
7659  continue;
7660  }
7661  const Type *callTypeNP = callType;
7662  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(callType)) {
7663  callTypeNP = callType->GetReferenceTarget();
7664  // we can treat vfr as vf for callType with some penalty
7665  // Step "5" from documentation
7666  cost[i] += 2 * costScale;
7667  }
7668 
7669  // Now we deal with references, so we can normalize to non-const types
7670  // because we're passing by value anyway, so const doesn't matter.
7671  const Type *callTypeNC = callTypeNP, *fargTypeNC = fargType;
7672  callTypeNC = callTypeNP->GetAsNonConstType();
7673  fargTypeNC = fargType->GetAsNonConstType();
7674 
7675  // Now we forget about constants and references!
7676  if (Type::Equal(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC)) {
7677  // The best case: vf -> vf.
7678  // Step "4" from documentation
7679  cost[i] += 1 * costScale;
7680  continue;
7681  }
7682  if (lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC)) {
7683  // A little bit worse case: vf -> vd.
7684  // Step "6" from documentation
7685  cost[i] += 8 * costScale;
7686  continue;
7687  }
7688  if (fargType->IsVaryingType() && callType->IsUniformType()) {
7689  // Here we deal with brodcasting uniform to varying.
7690  // callType - varying and fargType - uniform is forbidden.
7691  if (Type::Equal(callTypeNC->GetAsVaryingType(), fargTypeNC)) {
7692  // uf -> vf is better than uf -> ui or uf -> ud
7693  // Step "7" from documentation
7694  cost[i] += 16 * costScale;
7695  continue;
7696  }
7697  if (lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(callTypeNC->GetAsVaryingType(), fargTypeNC)) {
7698  // uf -> vd is better than uf -> vi (128 < 128 + 64)
7699  // but worse than uf -> ui (128 > 64)
7700  // Step "9" from documentation
7701  cost[i] += 128 * costScale;
7702  continue;
7703  }
7704  // 128 + 64 is the max. uf -> vi is the worst case.
7705  // Step "10" from documentation
7706  cost[i] += 128 * costScale;
7707  }
7708  if (CanConvertTypes(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
7709  // two cases: the worst is 128 + 64: uf -> vi and
7710  // the only 64: (64 < 128) uf -> ui worse than uf -> vd
7711  // Step "8" from documentation
7712  cost[i] += 64 * costScale;
7713  else
7714  // Failure--no type conversion possible...
7715  return -1;
7716  }
7717  }
7718 
7719  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
7720  costSum = costSum + cost[i];
7721  }
7722  return costSum;
7723 }
7724 
7725 bool FunctionSymbolExpr::ResolveOverloads(SourcePos argPos, const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
7726  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
7727  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
7728  const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
7729  if (triedToResolve == true) {
7730  return true;
7731  }
7732 
7733  triedToResolve = true;
7734 
7735  // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
7736  // builtins. For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
7737  // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
7738  // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
7739  // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
7740  // called.
7741  bool exactMatchOnly = (name.substr(0, 2) == "__");
7742 
7743  // First, find the subset of overload candidates that take the same
7744  // number of arguments as have parameters (including functions that
7745  // take more arguments but have defaults starting no later than after
7746  // our last parameter).
7747  std::vector<Symbol *> actualCandidates = getCandidateFunctions(argTypes.size());
7748 
7749  int bestMatchCost = 1 << 30;
7750  std::vector<Symbol *> matches;
7751  std::vector<int> candidateCosts;
7752  std::vector<int *> candidateExpandCosts;
7753 
7754  if (actualCandidates.size() == 0)
7755  goto failure;
7756 
7757  // Compute the cost for calling each of the candidate functions
7758  for (int i = 0; i < (int)actualCandidates.size(); ++i) {
7759  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(actualCandidates[i]->type);
7760  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
7761  int *cost = new int[argTypes.size()];
7762  candidateCosts.push_back(computeOverloadCost(ft, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL, argIsConstant, cost));
7763  candidateExpandCosts.push_back(cost);
7764  }
7765 
7766  // Find the best cost, and then the candidate or candidates that have
7767  // that cost.
7768  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
7769  if (candidateCosts[i] != -1 && candidateCosts[i] < bestMatchCost)
7770  bestMatchCost = candidateCosts[i];
7771  }
7772  // None of the candidates matched
7773  if (bestMatchCost == (1 << 30))
7774  goto failure;
7775  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
7776  if (candidateCosts[i] == bestMatchCost) {
7777  for (int j = 0; j < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++j) {
7778  for (int k = 0; k < argTypes.size(); k++) {
7779  if (candidateCosts[j] != -1 && candidateExpandCosts[j][k] < candidateExpandCosts[i][k]) {
7780  std::vector<Symbol *> temp;
7781  temp.push_back(actualCandidates[i]);
7782  temp.push_back(actualCandidates[j]);
7783  std::string candidateMessage = lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(temp, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
7784  Warning(pos,
7785  "call to \"%s\" is ambiguous. "
7786  "This warning will be turned into error in the next ispc release.\n"
7787  "Please add explicit cast to arguments to have unambiguous match."
7788  "\n%s",
7789  funName, candidateMessage.c_str());
7790  }
7791  }
7792  }
7793  matches.push_back(actualCandidates[i]);
7794  }
7795  }
7796  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateExpandCosts.size(); ++i) {
7797  delete[] candidateExpandCosts[i];
7798  }
7799 
7800  if (matches.size() == 1) {
7801  // Only one match: success
7802  matchingFunc = matches[0];
7803  return true;
7804  } else if (matches.size() > 1) {
7805  // Multiple matches: ambiguous
7806  std::string candidateMessage = lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
7807  Error(pos,
7808  "Multiple overloaded functions matched call to function "
7809  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s",
7810  funName, exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "", candidateMessage.c_str());
7811  return false;
7812  } else {
7813  // No matches at all
7814  failure:
7815  std::string candidateMessage = lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
7816  Error(pos,
7817  "Unable to find any matching overload for call to function "
7818  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s",
7819  funName, exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "", candidateMessage.c_str());
7820  return false;
7821  }
7822 }
7823 
7824 Symbol *FunctionSymbolExpr::GetMatchingFunction() { return matchingFunc; }
7825 
7826 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7827 // SyncExpr
7828 
7829 const Type *SyncExpr::GetType() const { return AtomicType::Void; }
7830 
7831 llvm::Value *SyncExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7832  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7833  ctx->SyncInst();
7834  return NULL;
7835 }
7836 
7837 int SyncExpr::EstimateCost() const { return COST_SYNC; }
7838 
7839 void SyncExpr::Print() const {
7840  printf("sync");
7841  pos.Print();
7842 }
7843 
7844 Expr *SyncExpr::TypeCheck() { return this; }
7845 
7846 Expr *SyncExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
7847 
7848 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7849 // NullPointerExpr
7850 
7851 llvm::Value *NullPointerExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7852  return llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
7853 }
7854 
7855 const Type *NullPointerExpr::GetType() const { return PointerType::Void; }
7856 
7857 Expr *NullPointerExpr::TypeCheck() { return this; }
7858 
7859 Expr *NullPointerExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
7860 
7861 llvm::Constant *NullPointerExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7862  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
7863  if (pt == NULL)
7864  return NULL;
7865 
7866  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7867  if (llvmType == NULL) {
7868  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7869  return NULL;
7870  }
7871 
7872  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
7873 }
7874 
7875 void NullPointerExpr::Print() const {
7876  printf("NULL");
7877  pos.Print();
7878 }
7879 
7880 int NullPointerExpr::EstimateCost() const { return 0; }
7881 
7882 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7883 // NewExpr
7884 
7885 NewExpr::NewExpr(int typeQual, const Type *t, Expr *init, Expr *count, SourcePos tqPos, SourcePos p)
7886  : Expr(p, NewExprID) {
7887  allocType = t;
7888 
7889  initExpr = init;
7890  countExpr = count;
7891 
7892  /* (The below cases actually should be impossible, since the parser
7893  doesn't allow more than a single type qualifier before a "new".) */
7894  if ((typeQual & ~(TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM | TYPEQUAL_VARYING)) != 0) {
7895  Error(tqPos, "Illegal type qualifiers in \"new\" expression (only "
7896  "\"uniform\" and \"varying\" are allowed.");
7897  isVarying = false;
7898  } else if ((typeQual & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0 && (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0) {
7899  Error(tqPos, "Illegal to provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" "
7900  "qualifiers to \"new\" expression.");
7901  isVarying = false;
7902  } else
7903  // If no type qualifier is given before the 'new', treat it as a
7904  // varying new.
7905  isVarying = (typeQual == 0) || (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING);
7906 
7907  if (allocType != NULL)
7908  allocType = allocType->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
7909 }
7910 
7911 llvm::Value *NewExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7912  bool do32Bit = (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing);
7913 
7914  // Determine how many elements we need to allocate. Note that this
7915  // will be a varying value if this is a varying new.
7916  llvm::Value *countValue;
7917  if (countExpr != NULL) {
7918  countValue = countExpr->GetValue(ctx);
7919  if (countValue == NULL) {
7920  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7921  return NULL;
7922  }
7923  } else {
7924  if (isVarying) {
7925  if (do32Bit)
7926  countValue = LLVMInt32Vector(1);
7927  else
7928  countValue = LLVMInt64Vector(1);
7929  } else {
7930  if (do32Bit)
7931  countValue = LLVMInt32(1);
7932  else
7933  countValue = LLVMInt64(1);
7934  }
7935  }
7936 
7937  // Compute the total amount of memory to allocate, allocSize, as the
7938  // product of the number of elements to allocate and the size of a
7939  // single element.
7940  llvm::Value *eltSize = g->target->SizeOf(allocType->LLVMType(g->ctx), ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
7941  if (isVarying)
7942  eltSize = ctx->SmearUniform(eltSize, "smear_size");
7943  llvm::Value *allocSize = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, countValue, eltSize, "alloc_size");
7944 
7945  // Determine which allocation builtin function to call: uniform or
7946  // varying, and taking 32-bit or 64-bit allocation counts.
7947  llvm::Function *func;
7948  if (isVarying) {
7949  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
7950  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_32rt");
7951  } else if (g->opt.force32BitAddressing) {
7952  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_64rt");
7953  } else {
7954  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying64_64rt");
7955  }
7956  } else {
7957  // FIXME: __new_uniform_32rt should take i32
7958  if (allocSize->getType() != LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
7959  allocSize = ctx->SExtInst(allocSize, LLVMTypes::Int64Type, "alloc_size64");
7960  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
7961  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_32rt");
7962  } else {
7963  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_64rt");
7964  }
7965  }
7966  AssertPos(pos, func != NULL);
7967 
7968  // Make the call for the the actual allocation.
7969  llvm::Value *ptrValue = ctx->CallInst(func, NULL, allocSize, "new");
7970 
7971  // Now handle initializers and returning the right type for the result.
7972  const Type *retType = GetType();
7973  if (retType == NULL)
7974  return NULL;
7975  if (isVarying) {
7976  if (g->target->is32Bit())
7977  // Convert i64 vector values to i32 if we are compiling to a
7978  // 32-bit target.
7979  ptrValue = ctx->TruncInst(ptrValue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType, "ptr_to_32bit");
7980 
7981  if (initExpr != NULL) {
7982  // If we have an initializer expression, emit code that checks
7983  // to see if each lane is active and if so, runs the code to do
7984  // the initialization. Note that we're we're taking advantage
7985  // of the fact that the __new_varying*() functions are
7986  // implemented to return NULL for program instances that aren't
7987  // executing; more generally, we should be using the current
7988  // execution mask for this...
7989  for (int i = 0; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i) {
7990  llvm::BasicBlock *bbInit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("init_ptr");
7991  llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkip = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_init");
7992  llvm::Value *p = ctx->ExtractInst(ptrValue, i);
7993  llvm::Value *nullValue = g->target->is32Bit() ? LLVMInt32(0) : LLVMInt64(0);
7994  // Is the pointer for the current lane non-zero?
7995  llvm::Value *nonNull =
7996  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, p, nullValue, "non_null");
7997  ctx->BranchInst(bbInit, bbSkip, nonNull);
7998 
7999  // Initialize the memory pointed to by the pointer for the
8000  // current lane.
8001  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbInit);
8002  llvm::Type *ptrType = retType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8003  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->IntToPtrInst(p, ptrType);
8004  InitSymbol(ptr, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8005  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkip);
8006 
8007  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkip);
8008  }
8009  }
8010 
8011  return ptrValue;
8012  } else {
8013  // For uniform news, we just need to cast the void * to be a
8014  // pointer of the return type and to run the code for initializers,
8015  // if present.
8016  llvm::Type *ptrType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8017  ptrValue = ctx->BitCastInst(ptrValue, ptrType, LLVMGetName(ptrValue, "_cast_ptr"));
8018 
8019  if (initExpr != NULL)
8020  InitSymbol(ptrValue, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8021 
8022  return ptrValue;
8023  }
8024 }
8025 
8026 const Type *NewExpr::GetType() const {
8027  if (allocType == NULL)
8028  return NULL;
8029 
8030  return isVarying ? PointerType::GetVarying(allocType) : PointerType::GetUniform(allocType);
8031 }
8032 
8033 Expr *NewExpr::TypeCheck() {
8034  // It's illegal to call new with an undefined struct type
8035  if (allocType == NULL) {
8036  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8037  return NULL;
8038  }
8039 #ifdef ISPC_NVPTX_ENABLED
8040  if (g->target->getISA() == Target::NVPTX && allocType->IsVaryingType()) {
8041  Error(pos, "\"new\" with varying data types is not yet supported with \"nvptx\" target.");
8042  return NULL;
8043  }
8044 #endif /* ISPC_NVPTX_ENABLED */
8045  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(allocType) != NULL) {
8046  Error(pos,
8047  "Can't dynamically allocate storage for declared "
8048  "but not defined type \"%s\".",
8049  allocType->GetString().c_str());
8050  return NULL;
8051  }
8052  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(allocType);
8053  if (st != NULL && !st->IsDefined()) {
8054  Error(pos,
8055  "Can't dynamically allocate storage for declared "
8056  "type \"%s\" containing undefined member type.",
8057  allocType->GetString().c_str());
8058  return NULL;
8059  }
8060 
8061  // Otherwise we only need to make sure that if we have an expression
8062  // giving a number of elements to allocate that it can be converted to
8063  // an integer of the appropriate variability.
8064  if (countExpr == NULL)
8065  return this;
8066 
8067  const Type *countType;
8068  if ((countType = countExpr->GetType()) == NULL)
8069  return NULL;
8070 
8071  if (isVarying == false && countType->IsVaryingType()) {
8072  Error(pos, "Illegal to provide \"varying\" allocation count with "
8073  "\"uniform new\" expression.");
8074  return NULL;
8075  }
8076 
8077  // Figure out the type that the allocation count should be
8078  const Type *t =
8079  (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
8080  if (isVarying)
8081  t = t->GetAsVaryingType();
8082 
8083  countExpr = TypeConvertExpr(countExpr, t, "item count");
8084  if (countExpr == NULL)
8085  return NULL;
8086 
8087  return this;
8088 }
8089 
8090 Expr *NewExpr::Optimize() { return this; }
8091 
8092 void NewExpr::Print() const { printf("new (%s)", allocType ? allocType->GetString().c_str() : "NULL"); }
8093 
8094 int NewExpr::EstimateCost() const { return COST_NEW; }
